dmTitle.infoName: Change = remove and install a new item

exportRegistrationStmt.simplePara: This document contains technical data whose export is restricted by the Arms Export Control Act (Title 22, U.S.C., Sec. 2751 et seq.) or the Export Administration Act of 1979, as amended (Title 50, U.S.C., App. 2401, et seq.). Violation of these export-control laws is subject to severe criminal penalties. Dissemination of this document is controlled under DoD Directive 5230.25.

restrictionInstructions.dataDestruction: For unclassified, limited documents, destroy by any method that shall prevent disclosure of contents or reconstruction of the document.

commonInfoDescrPara.title: Blower Motor Replacement.
commonInfoDescrPara.para: The blower motor replacement procedure due to failure is identical to the preventative maintenance replacement procedure described in the PMS. Chapter 7, figure 7-7, provides an illustrated breakdown of the component to assist the operator.

note.notePara: The in-process leak test shall be conducted using purge gas.

A low pressure gas purge is used to protect an activated catalysts bed from exposure to air. Purge gas flow needs only to be high enough to prevent air from flowing back into the Byproduct Management Plantcatalyst bed.
If the blower motor housing is to remain open for any length of time, place a temporary cover over the opening to maintain system cleanliness.
Prior to starting the blower motor removal, a proper container should be established to store any waste generated in accordance with local instructions.
Non-metallic waste (packings, O-rings, etc.) shall be containerized for shore disposal. Additional guidance may be obtained from OPNAVINST 5090.1 and OPNAVINST 5100.19.

Contaminated rags/cloths (rags/cloths contaminated with a hazardous substance) shall be containerized for shore disposal. Additional guidance may be obtained in OPNAVINST 5090.1 and OPNAVINST 5100.19.

proceduralStep.para: Inspect the replacement blower motor assembly for damage.
Conduct a room temperature motor windings resistance and continuity check in accordance with table 6-11.
Conduct a room temperature liquid level sensor resistance and continuity check in accordance with table 6-12.
Conduct a motor windings insulation resistance check using a megohm-meter as follows:
Connect the negative (-) test lead of the megohm-meter to the ground pin #7.
Connect the positive (+) test lead of the megohm-meter to the input pin #1.
Configure the megohm-meter to provide a voltage potential of +450 to +550 VDC.
Energize the megohm-meter and apply the test voltage for approximately 1 minute. De-energize the megohm-meter to zero.
The minimum room temperature resistance is 1000 megohms.
Repeat step d (2) thru step d (5) for pins #2 and #3.
Conduct an instrument insulation resistance check using a megohm-meter as follows:
Connect the negative (-) test lead of the megohm-meter to the ground pin.
Connect the positive (+) test lead of the megohm-meter to the input pin #6.
Configure the megohm-meter to provide a voltage potential of +90 to +110 VDC.
Energize the megohm-meter and apply the test voltage for approximately 1 minute. De-energize the megohm-meter to zero.
The minimum room temperature resistance is 100 megohms.
Repeat step e (2) thru step e (5) for pins #7 and #8.

Perform the preliminary actions to access the blower motor housing using
paragraph 6.3.4.3.1 and
paragraph 6.3.4.3.2.
Isolate the Active Storage Unit from the BMP as follows:
Align the ILPE to operate with the BMP secured (refer to paragraph 2.4.8.2).

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Oxidizer(s) must be operational or the ship surface ventilating prior to inboard venting of the recycling loop. Recycle gases are combustible.

proceduralStep.para: Lower the level in the ASU tank to less than 50 percent.
Vent the BMP to ambient (refer to paragraph 2.4.9.1).

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Use care when removing the line from fitting F23 as residual pressure may exist in the line. PPE including eye protection per OPNAVINST 5100.19 is required.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Carefully monitor ASU tank level and pressure. With the test cap installed on fitting F23, rupture disk overpressure protection is not available for the ASU tank. ASU tank overpressure protection is provided by the RCU.

proceduralStep.para: Shut manual valve MV-910A.
Disconnect the fitting F23 from the ASU and install the test cap and plug (cap and plug are stored on face of ASU).
Prepare for gas purge as follows:
Check manual valves MV-397-1B and MV-397-2B shut and carefully remove drain cap from F6.
Attach drain hose to F6.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: The blower motor housing is pressurized from 10-750 psig. PPE including eye protection per OPNAVINST 5100-19 is required when draining. Spray may cause injury. If personnel exposure occurs, immediately flush effected area with water and seek medical attention, if required.

proceduralStep.para: Check manual valves MV-401A, MV-413G and MV-430B shut.
Open manual valve MV-397-2B.
Carefully open manual valve MV-397-1B to vent any liquid to a suitable container.
Shut manual valve MV-397-2B.
Remove drain hose from F6 and reinstall drain cap to F6.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Do not move blower motor housing cover without assistance. Unit weighs approximately 200 pounds.

proceduralStep.para: Verify purge gas aligned to the ILPE.
Remove the blower motor housing cover as follows:
Remove the insulation cap from the blower motor housing cover. Save for reuse.

Remove thirteen blower motor housing cover bolts and washers, leaving two diagonally opposite bolts. Loosen the two remaining bolts to allow for approximately one inch clearance between the bottom of the bolt and the top of the cover.
Coat the threads of the lifting eyebolt with MOLYKOTE P-37 lubricant or an approved lubricant, if required.

Ensure that the locknut is threaded all the way onto the eyebolt. Install the lifting eyebolt and locknut into the blower motor housing cover. Tighten the eyebolt into the blower motor housing cover until the locknut makes contact with the housing cover. Torque the locknut to 9.5 - 11.5 ft-lb. Assemble the lifting arm to the GPU frame.
Attach the lifting arm to the GPU frame.

note.notePara: The frame mounting holes are not marked but will be readily identified when the access panels are removed.

proceduralStep.para: Attach the lifting arm hook to the eyebolt.
Lift the blower motor housing cover until it contacts the remaining bolts.
Slowly open manual valve MV-430B to establish the gas purge flow out of the blower motor housing. The flow is to prevent air from entering the recycle loop.
Once the purge is established, remove the two remaining blower motor housing cover bolts and washers.
Remove the blower motor housing cover and set aside.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Do not move blower motor assembly without assistance. Unit weighs approximately 200 pounds.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Protect the blower motor housing flange when removing and installing the blower motor assembly.

proceduralStep.para: Mask off and protect top sealing surface of blower housing.
Remove the blower motor assembly as follows:
Loosen the two outside hose clamps on the blower motor muffler assembly and remove the assembly.
Using the spanner wrench (SV805522-1 or NV1012919-1), disconnect electrical plug connector P-1331 from the inside of the blower motor housing.
Using the spanner wrench (SV805522-1 or NV1012919-1), disconnect electrical plug connectors P-371 from the inside of the blower motor housing.
Disconnect the grounding strap from the blower motor assembly by removing the blower to motor mounting bolt. Re-install bolt and washer finger tight.
Install the lifting eyebolt on the blower motor assembly. Tighten securely.
Attach the lifting arm hook to the lifting eyebolt on the blower motor assembly.
Place tension on the lift arm to unload the blower motor assembly from the shock mounts.
Remove the four screws holding the upper shock mounts to the blower motor housing. Save for reuse.
Using the special Allen wrench extension tool, loosen the four screws holding the bottom support plate to the blower motor housing.
Slowly remove the blower motor assembly from the housing. Once the assembly is clear of the housing, remove the four screws from the bottom support plate. Save for reuse.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Do not set blower motor assembly down on its bottom side as damage to the liquid level sensor attached to the bottom of the flange is possible.

proceduralStep.para: Wipe the blower motor assembly thoroughly. Properly dispose of the waste.
Lower the blower motor assembly to the deck, wiring harness side up and set aside.
Remove the sound absorbent bag from the base of the blower motor housing.
Wash the sound absorbent bag in warm soapy water.
Rinse in potable water.
Drain the excess water on to a lint free cloth.

note.notePara: Contaminated rags/cloths (rags/cloths contaminated with a hazardous substance) shall be containerized for shore disposal. Additional guidance may be obtained in OPNAVINST 5090.1 and OPNAVINST 5100.19.

proceduralStep.para: Properly dispose of the waste.
Wipe out the blower motor housing interior thoroughly. Properly dispose of the waste.
Install the sound absorbent bag in the base of the blower motor housing.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Do not move blower motor assembly without assistance. Unit weighs approximately 200 pounds.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Protect the blower motor housing flange when removing and installing the blower motor assembly.

proceduralStep.para: Remove the lifting eyebolt from the used blower motor assembly and attach the eyebolt to the replacement blower motor assembly. Tighten securely.
Install the blower motor assembly as follows:
Attach the lifting arm hook to the blower motor assembly eyebolt. Lift and swing the blower motor assembly over the housing opening.
Remove any protective cover installed.

Lightly coat the four bottom support plate screws with MOLYKOTE P-37 lubricant or an approved lubricant and install into the bottom support plate. This coating will assist in holding the screws in place.

With the blower motor assembly outlet tube facing the blower motor housing electrical connectors, slowly lower the blower motor assembly into the housing until the locating pins engage in the lower mounting plate.
Using the special Allen wrench extension tool, start each screw into the threaded hole in the mounting surface.

Finish lowering the blower motor assembly until the base contacts the lower mounting plate. Maintain slight tension on the blower motor assembly to allow alignment of the upper shock mount screws. Torque the four screws to 20.4 - 24.0 ft-lb.

Lightly coat the four shock mounting screws with MOLYKOTE P-37 lubricant or an approved lubricant and install through the upper shock mounts into the blower motor housing. Torque to between 20.4 and 24.0 ft-lb increments in a crossing pattern.
Release the remaining tension of the lifting arm allowing the blower motor to settle.
Remove the lifting arm hook from the blower motor assembly lifting eyebolt.
Remove the lifting eye from the blower motor assembly.
Remove the blower to motor grounding strap bolt and washer. Lightly coat the bolt with MOLYKOTE P-37 lubricant or an approved lubricant.
Install the grounding strap from the blower motor assembly to the blower to motor mounting bolt. Torque to 27 - 32 ft-lb.
Inspect the seals on the electrical bulkhead connectors. Replace if necessary.
Using the spanner wrench (SV805522-1 or NV1012919-1), install electrical plug connector P-1331 from the inside of the blower motor housing.
Using the spanner wrench (SV805522-1 or NV1012919-1), install electrical plug connectors P-371 from the inside of the blower motor housing.

Install the replacement blower motor muffler assembly between the blower outlet tube and the blower housing outlet tube stub using the hose clamps. The muffler end which contains the white teflon disk connects to the blower motor housing tube stub with the undercut portion facing up. This provides adequate clearance when the blower motor housing cover is installed.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: The torque requirement for the blower motor muffler is critical. Ensure the proper torque is applied to the hose clamps.

proceduralStep.para: Using a straight edge, check that all of the blower motor muffler assembly is below the blower motor housing upper lip. This is noise critical and no contact between the blower motor muffler and the blower motor housing and/or cover is permitted.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Do not move blower motor housing cover without assistance. Unit weighs approximately 200 pounds.

proceduralStep.para: Torque the hose clamps to 20 - 24 in.-lb.
Install the blower motor housing cover as follows:
Remove the seal from the blower motor housing groove.
Wipe the blower motor housing seal groove clean.
Lightly coat the blower motor housing cover bolts with MOLYKOTE P-37 lubricant or an approved lubricant, if required.
Lightly coat the blower motor housing seal with BRAYCOTE 601 lubricant or an approved lubricant and install in the blower motor housing seal groove.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Step o(7) thru step o(9) must be performed quickly. If the blower motor housing cover cannot be set in place within 10 minutes, the gas purge must be reestablished.

proceduralStep.para: Attach the lifting arm hook to the blower motor housing cover. Wipe underside of cover to remove any debris or contaminants. Move the cover over the blower motor housing.
Position the cover over the blower motor housing and align the arrows stamped in the housing and cover.
Shut manual valve MV-430B.
Lower the blower motor housing cover until two diagonally opposite bolts can be threaded into the blower motor housing. Lower the blower motor housing cover completely onto the housing.
Install the remaining thirteen bolts and washers to secure the blower motor housing cover. Torque to between 260 and 310 ft-lb in 50 ft-lb increments using a crossing pattern.
Remove the lifting arm hook from the blower motor housing cover eyebolt and remove the eyebolt.
Remove the lifting arm from the GPU frame.
Install the insulation cap on the blower motor housing cover.
Align the Active Storage Unit to the BMP as follows:
Open manual valve MV-910A.
Carefully remove the test cap (store on ASU face) from bulkhead fitting F23 and install the line leading to the BMP.

Perform the steps to return the ILPE to an operational condition using
paragraph 6.3.4.3.3 and
paragraph 6.3.4.3.4.
Verify the circuit breakers that supply 440 VAC, 60 Hz, 3-phase and 115 VAC, 60 Hz, single phase power to the ILPE are closed.
Turn the LIB ON-OFF/RESET switch ON and verify the ILPE is energized and in the OFF mode.

From the Top Level (Main) Screen, select the BMP Screen. Verify P-1334-1B and P-1334-2B are above 80 psig. If the pressure is below 80 psig, increase recycle loop pressure to 80-100 psig with purge gas using manual valve MV-430B.
Secure the purge gas system alignment to the ILPE by shutting manual valve MV-430B.
Perform the blower motor check out test as follows:
Manually start the blower motor.
After four minutes, observe sensor DPT-1335B for a reading above 2.5 indicating proper blower motor operation.
Manually secure the blower motor.

note.notePara: Contaminated rags/cloths (rags/cloths contaminated with a hazardous substance) shall be containerized for shore disposal. Additional guidance may be obtained in OPNAVINST 5090.1 and OPNAVINST 5100.19.

proceduralStep.para: Properly dispose of any solid waste.
